channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Amazon’s ‘free, no hassle returns’ issue results in over $1 billion settlement
item.description: Amazon is resolving claims that it incorrectly processed returns with a proposed settlement valued at over $1 billion, as reported earlier by Reuters and Bloomberg Law. The settlement includes $600 million in refunds, along with an additional $309.5 million in payments to affected customers. Initially filed in 2023, the class action lawsuit claims that while […]...

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem en 4K jusqu’à 120 fps sur PS5 Pro ? Capcom le promet
item.description: Akishi Nakanishi, directeur de Resident Evil Requiem, affirme que le jeu sera beau et fluide sur PS5 Pro.

item.title: Samsung dévoile le prix du Galaxy Z TriFold et c’est exactement ce à quoi on s’attendait
item.description: Après une première annonce du produit et des prises en main par la presse, Samsung confirme le prix de son premier smartphone pliant en trois parties. Un tarif tout juste sous les 3 000 dollars, totalement prohibitif.

item.title: Windows 11 se débarrasse définitivement de cette technologie historique utilisée par de nombreuses entreprises
item.description: De nombreux modems ne fonctionnent plus depuis la dernière mise à jour de Windows 11. Et pour une fois, ce n'est pas un bug, mais bien une décision délibérée de la part de Microsoft.

item.title: I’m a laptop expert, so trust me when I say this Dell 14 Plus 2-in-1 deal at Best Buy is an essential payday purchase — at just $649.99, it’s nearly half the price Dell sells it for
item.description: Dell’s 14-inch Plus 2-in-1 laptop has dropped to just $649.99 at Best Buy and comes with an Intel Core Ultra 7 processor, 16GB of DDR5 memory, and a 1TB SSD.

item.title: How a Microbe Tunnels Its Way Through an Insect Gut—It’s Weirder Than You Think
item.description: Some microbes can squeeze through tight spaces by wrapping themselves in their flagellum—the tail-like structure they use to move. Also, how adorable are those little guys?

item.title: Luminar receives a larger $33 million bid for its lidar business
item.description: A new leading bidder has appeared in the Luminar bankruptcy case: Redmond, Washington-based MicroVision, which beat out Quantum Computing Inc.'s bid by $5 million.

item.title: Experts flag around 800,000 Telnet servers exposed to remote attacks - here's why users should be on their guard
item.description: Hackers are hunting for vulnerable endpoints to deploy Python malware.

item.title: China’s Moonshot releases a new open-source model Kimi K2.5 and a coding agent
item.description: The company said that the model was trained on 15 trillion mixed visual and text tokens.

item.title: E-Book Checkouts of ‘Heated Rivalry’ Shoot Up 529% in NYC After Mayor Encourages People to Stay Home and Read the Gay Hockey Book
item.description: Boys' Love is the only light left in our messed-up world.

item.title: AMD could be working on a way to minimize RAM price hike pain — by bundling Ryzen CPUs and DDR5 memory
item.description: An official collaboration between AMD, V-Color and Cooler Master hints at more possible bundle deals in the future.

item.title: Pinterest cuts workforce by around 15 percent to focus on AI
item.description: Pinterest is planning to lay off hundreds of workers and reduce its office space to reallocate resources for its artificial intelligence initiatives. In a regulatory filing posted Tuesday, Pinterest says the reduction is expected to impact "less than 15 percent" of its current workforce, and that the layoffs should be complete by September 30th, 2026. […]...

item.title: « La voiture électrique est tout simplement un produit supérieur » : pourquoi Volvo enterre le thermique pour 2026
item.description: On entend souvent que la transition électrique patine. Pas chez Volvo. Anders Bell, le CTO, vient de lâcher une bombe technique : la plateforme SPA3. Fini les adaptations, place à une intégration verticale totale, du logiciel aux méga-castings. La promesse ? "Le changement technologique le plus profond de l'histoire de l'automobile".

item.title: Could the MCU Already Be Looking for a New Black Panther?
item.description: Plus, Sam Raimi wants in on a new 'Darkman'.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Z Trifold U.S. Price Is Not at All Surprising
item.description: You already knew the foldable phone was going to be really expensive.

item.title: The Samsung Trifold will cost nearly three grand
item.description: Samsung's much-anticipated Galaxy Z Trifold goes on sale on this Friday, January 26th, and the price is every bit as steep as we'd feared: $2,899, which gets you 512GB of storage and a phone that kind of wants to be a tablet all the time. The Trifold first premiered in Korea late last year, so […]

item.title: Node-based design tool Flora raises $42M from Redpoint Ventures
item.description: Flora's node-based design tool is being used by companies like Pentagram and Lionsgate.

item.title: The Galaxy Z TriFold finally has a US price and launch date — and it's Samsung's priciest foldable yet
item.description: Samsung’s ambitious triple-folding phone is finally priced in the US. The Galaxy Z TriFold launches on January 30 for $2,899 and unfolds into a 10-inch AMOLED display.

item.title: The Samsung Galaxy Z Trifold will cost $2,900 in the US
item.description: As promised, Samsung is bringing its Galaxy Z Trifold smartphone to shoppers in the US. The unique foldable goes on sale on January 30. The phone was announced along with its select markets' sale dates at the close of 2025. We didn't have price information for Samsung's domestic market at that time, and even though we were anticipating the Galaxy Z Trifold to cost a bundle, the actual cost is more absurd than we'd guessed. In reality, getting your hands on this slim triple-screen smartphone will run you $2,900. Putting aside the ludicrous expense, this smartphone is pretty dang cool. After his...

item.title: Theorem wants to stop AI-written bugs before they ship — and just raised $6M to do it
item.description: As artificial intelligence reshapes software development, a small startup is betting that the industry's next big bottleneck won't be writing code — it will be trusting it.Theorem, a San Francisco-based company that emerged from Y Combinator's Spring 2025 batch, announced Tuesday it has raised $6 million in seed funding to build automated tools that verify the correctness of AI-generated software. Khosla Ventures led the round, with participation from Y Combinator, e14, SAIF, Halcyon, and angel investors including Blake Borgesson, co-founder of Recursion Pharmaceuticals, and Arthur Breitman, c...

item.title: Intel’s Panther Lake CPUs Make the Best Case for ‘Fake Frames’ in Gaming
item.description: The new Core Ultra Series 3 chips and XeSS 3 AI upscaler can juice up frame rates on laptops, but handhelds may benefit the most.

item.title: 'The next chapter begins' — Blizzard announces several showcases that will share plans for the future of World of Warcraft, Overwatch, Diablo, and Hearthstone
item.description: Blizzard Entertainment has announced a series of special showcases that will reveal the plans for its four biggest franchises, World of Warcraft, Overwatch, Diablo, and Hearthstone.

item.title: ELEGOO Debuts Its First Multicolor FDM 3D Printer With the Centauri Carbon 2 Combo
item.description: Bringing your creative ideas to life has never been easier.

item.title: Truth and AI in Minneapolis
item.description: When federal agents killed Alex Pretti in Minneapolis on Saturday morning, video of the shooting - from lots of people, and lots of angles, with wildly varying levels of quality - immediately began to fly around the internet. This is what always happens in times like these, and there have unfortunately been a lot of […]

item.title: Apple et Google distribuent des dizaines d’apps qui dénudent les femmes
item.description: Il n'y a pas que Grok qui dénude les femmes sans leur consentement. Il existe des dizaines d'applications distribuées par les boutiques d'Apple et de Google qui proposent ce type de « service », en contradiction totale avec les politiques d'Apple et de Google.

item.title: Hurry! This 16-inch touch screen Dell laptop is just $749.99, a huge saving of $320 — and with an Intel Core 7 processor, 16GB DDR5 memory, and a 1TB SSD, it's perfect for a payday splurge
item.description: Dell’s 16-inch touch screen laptop is now just $749.99 and comes with an Intel Core 7 processor, 16GB DDR5 memory, and a 1TB SSD.

item.title: The Best Ski Goggles, Editor Tested and Reviewed (2026)
item.description: From bluebird days to blizzards, WIRED tested the best ski goggles for all weather conditions.

item.title: Ce SSD alllant jusqu’à 11 000 Mo/s est bradé à moins de 100 € pour la fin des soldes
item.description: Vous recherchez un SSD ultra-performant pour votre PC lors des soldes ? Voici le Crucial P510, capable d'atteindre 11 000 Mo/s et doté de 1 To de capacité qui est actuellement proposé à seulement 99 euros au lieu de 149,99 euros au départ. Une excellente opportunité à saisir avant la hausse des prix !

item.title: Nike layoffs: Hundreds of jobs cut in latest round as shoe giant cites supply chain automation
item.description: The iconic brand is starting 2026 by laying off workers, marking the third year in a row that it’s downsized its workforce. America’s most iconic shoe giant is starting 2026 by laying off workers. Nike has confirmed that it will lay off 775 employees in the United States. The move marks the third year in a row that Nike has cut jobs. Here’s what you need to know about the latest Nike layoffs....

item.title: Lego has a new round of Star Wars sets that work with the Smart Brick
item.description: Lego unveiled its Smart Play system at CES 2026 earlier this month, with a selection of sets designed for the engaging feature. Now, the toy company has announced five new compatible sets — all Stars Wars themed — available now for pre-order. Anthony Daniels, the original C-3PO, shared the news during the Nuremberg Toy Fair. The Smart Play system, Lego's newest venture, involves a Smart Brick, Smart Tags and Smart Minifigures. Each Smart Brick has proximity sensors, an accelerometer, a speaker and more. The Smart Tags and Smart Minifigures relay what's happening to the Brick. For example, if ...

item.title: Intel Arc B770 : la carte graphique gaming annulée au profit d’une version Pro ?
item.description: Attendue depuis des mois par les gamers, la nouvelle carte graphique dédiée Intel Arc B770 pourrait bien avoir été escamotée par Intel, au profit d'une autre variante, cette fois destinée au marché professionnel et au segment plus lucratif des data centers.

item.title: US Army signs multi-billion dollar Salesforce deal - giving military recruiters access to Slack
item.description: Salesforce will provide productivity and collaboration software to the US Army for five to ten years in a multibillion-dollar deal.

item.title: Apple's AirPods Pro 3 are on sale for $199 right now
item.description:
The AirPods Pro 3 are on sale and back at their record low price of $199. This is marked down from $250, a hefty 20 percent discount. This model was just released in September of last year, so consider this a substantial discount for such a recent product. We gave these AirPods a score of 90 out of 100 in our review and we consider them the best wireless earbuds for iPhone users. The third generation model is a substantial update to an already impressive product, bringing new features like live translation to the table.
The AirPods Pro 3 also offer heart-rate tracking, allowing them to stre...

item.title: Ira Parker Teases a Big Event from ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Season 2
item.description: If you've read George R.R. Martin's 'The Sworn Sword,' you know the challenges that await production as the HBO series continues.

item.title: This Humanoid Is Ready to Bring You a Toothbrush
item.description: Fauna, a new startup, is betting that humanoid robots will find success as hospitality workers, research assistants, and entertainers.

item.title: Uber launches an ‘AV Labs’ division to gather driving data for robotaxi partners
item.description: Uber is not developing its own robotaxis again; instead it plans to collect and offer data. It's a bet that more volume will help autonomous vehicle partners solve the weirdest edge cases.

item.title: California will investigate TikTok's alleged censorship of anti-Trump posts
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom has announced that his office is investigating whether TikTok is truly censoring content critical of Trump, days after ByteDance finalized a deal to spin off its business in the US. Newsom made the announcement in response to a post on X, claiming that you can no longer send messages in the app with the word “Epstein” in it. Newsom’s office, in a separate post, said it was able to independently confirm instances wherein TikTok suppressed content critical of President Donald Trump. The governor’s office told Politico that it tried to send a direct message with t...

item.title: The Missing Export: Culture as Economic Infrastructure
item.description: How Cities Can Export Music Like Goods

item.title: Tech on your terms
item.description: The future of technology may not be faster or smarter, but slower and more intentional. Before the age of technological distraction, we lived more in tune with our bodies. We spent more time outdoors where the sun regulated our circadian rhythms, which has been scientifically proven to reduce anxiety and depression. Without constant distraction, people sat in their boredom, which became drivers of artistic endeavors, creative ideas, and human connection....

item.title: 3 shifts in crypto into 2026
item.description: Forget the price charts and focus on the trends really defining crypto’s role in everyday life.

item.title: Garmin might finally be launching its Whoop competitor as the Cirqa smart band leaks on its own website
item.description: Eagle-eyed Garmin users on Reddit managed to screenshot a leaked smart band – on Garmin's own website.

item.title: Taskrabbit’s founder: AI is making traditional skills obsolete
item.description: A look at the future of work from the woman who invented the gig economy In 2008, we published the first listing on a bare-bones website called RunMyErrand.com: a single task, posted by someone who needed help, to be completed by an individual who had opted into making their time and abilities available. At the time, it was an untested idea, launched in the midst of the worst financial downturn in a generation, and there was no established language for what we were building. The term “gig economy” did not yet exist, and there was no widely accepted model for how a person in need might hire a s...

item.title: « Windows 11 est sans doute dans le pire état de son histoire » : pourquoi Microsoft gâche la sortie des nouvelles puces Intel Panther Lake
item.description: Et si le principal ennemi du PC était Windows 11 ? L'état désastreux de l'OS de Microsoft pourrait bien entacher le lancement de nouveaux PC en ce début d'année 2026.

item.title: TikTok’s new US venture is in trouble – here are the 3 privacy-first apps people are flocking to instead
item.description: TikTok users are deleting the app in droves over privacy concerns, while smaller rivals are seeing a big boost in numbers.

item.title: Google Photos now lets you describe how to transform images into video
item.description: Google is giving Photos users more control over the app's generative AI photo-to-video feature. Google Photos now supports text prompts for video generation, according to the update announcement on Monday, allowing users to describe the specific movement, style, or effect they want to see when bringing still images to life. Text prompts join the existing […]...

item.title: Skyrim, Cyberpunk 2077… Modder vos jeux sur Steam Deck sera bientôt radicalement plus simple
item.description: Nexus Mods vient d'annoncer le futur support de son application Vortex aux machines tournant sur SteamOS. De quoi faciliter grandement le modding sur Steam Deck et la future Steam Machine.
